item_blurb: Public comments will be heard at 9:00 am for items not on the agenda, for no more than 30 minutes. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers will be given up to 3 minutes. For those unable to attend the early comment period, there may be additional comment time available later in the day. Note: Comments made during the general public comment period regarding matters pending before the Commission do not become part of the official record for those matters.

subitem_blurb: Application of Keith Ives for like-for-like replacement of existing 313 sq.ft. dock float of same size and configuration, to be assembled offsite and floated onsite at 5661 E. Sorrento Dr., Long Beach, Los Angeles County. (AY-LB)

(DV-V)

subitem_title: CD-0002-19 (U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, San Francisco)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: County of Santa Barbara LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-STB-18-0039-1-Part D (O’Neil Property Rezone)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on the County of Santa Barbara’s request to amend the Land Use Plan and Implementation Plan to change the land use and zoning designation of a property at 2551 Wallace Avenue in the community of Summerland from Recreation/Open Space to Single-Family Residential. (MS-V)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-4-CPN-19-0029 (Hawkins, Carpinteria)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by John Barrison of City of Carpinteria decision granting permit with conditions to Karen Hawkins for construction of new 2,313 sq.ft. single-family home with attached 537 sq.ft. 2-car garage, site grading and drainage improvements, landscape and hardscape improvements, new underground utilities and new side and rear perimeter fencing, at 5667 Calle Arena, Carpinteria, Santa Barbara County. (WH-V)

subitem_title: Application No. 4-18-0206 (California Department and Parks and Recreation, Gaviota State Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of California Dept. of Parks and Recreation to repair, protect and reopen pier at Gaviota State Beach through installation of 1700 tons of rock rip-rap, 90-ft. seaward extension, 49 vertical pilings, 15 batter piles, as well as removal and replacement of timber decking, guardrails, structural supports and cross bracing, Santa Barbara County. (CT-V)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report For Los Angeles County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-MNB-19-0030 (Manhattan Beach Open Volleyball Tournament, Manhattan Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by William Victor of City of Manhattan Beach permit granting with conditions the 2019 Manhattan Beach Open Volleyball Tournament to be held on public beach August 15-18, 2019, south of Manhattan Beach Pier, Manhattan Beach, Los Angeles County. (MR-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-18-0994 (Skylar Properties, LLC, Hermosa Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Skylar Properties, LLC to demolish 2-story, 2,591 sq.ft. duplex and construct 30-ft. high, 3-story, 4,393 sq.ft. single-family home with attached 2-car garage and roof deck at 55 18th St., Hermosa Beach, Los Angeles County. (AS-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-19-0128 (Hermosa Beach School District, Hermosa Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Hermosa Beach School District to demolish campus and construct new campus consisting of 2 new buildings, parking lot and play areas on 2.35 acres of 4.29 acre site, at 417 25th St., Hermosa Beach, Los Angeles County. (ES-LB)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report for Orange County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-NPB-17-0084-1-Part D (4-17) (Ocean Front Encroachments)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on the City of Newport Beach’s request to amend both the Land Use Plan and Local Implementation Plan portion of the certified LCP to expand the allowable residential beach encroachments zone on the Balboa Peninsula from 1400 E. Oceanfront to Channel Road, a maximum of 15 feet oceanward of ocean facing property lines. (LR-LB)

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach LCP Amendment No. 1-19 (LCP-5-NPB-19-0016-1). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by the City of Newport Beach to amend its Implementation Plan to add a new Parking Management Overlay District (PM Overlay) category and to create PM-1, a Parking Management Overlay District for the Balboa Village area of the City. (LR-LB)

item_title: Please note: W27a-b will share a single combined staff report and hearing

subitem_title: Application No. 5-18-0907 (Nerja Investments, LLC, Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Nerja Investments, LLC to subdivide 6,962 sq.ft. lot into 2 lots, and construction of new 3,604 sq.ft. single family home and garage on new 3,455 sq.ft. lot, at 219 17th St., Seal Beach, Orange County. (AY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-18-0908 (Nerja Investments, LLC, Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Nerja Investments, LLC to subdivide 6,962 sq.ft. lot into 2 lots, and construction of new 2,790 sq.ft. single family home and garage on new 3,508 sq.ft. lot, at 221 17th St., Seal Beach, Orange County. (AY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-18-0665 (Marquita LLC, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application by Marquita, LLC for coastal bluff stabilization (at 257, 259, and 261 W. Marquita) consisting of 13,475 cu.yds. of cut and 8,714 cu.yds. of fill for complete bluff reconstruction by benching the bluff for placement of compacted fill, bluff drainage improvements and restoration of native vegetation; demolition of single-family home and construction of 2-unit 8,179 sq.ft. condominium, with 966 sq.ft. 4-car garage and 1,906 sq.ft. in decks, pool/spa, and bluff top drainage improvements, at 259 W. Marquita, San Clemente, Orange County. (LR-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-18-0705 (Gallian, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of George Gallian to remove 30’ x 6’ wide public vertical access pier platform and four, 14-in. square concrete guide piles and expand existing 30’ x 6’ (180 sq.ft.) private dock system shared by 2 private properties by installing two, 14-in. square concrete marina guide piles; 38’ x 4’ wide finger; 14’.5” x 4’ wide headwalk; 3’ x 3’ knee; 18’ x 3’ knee totaling 332 sq.ft. The existing gangway will be re-used, as well as, two, 14-in. square concrete marina guide piles, with shared 512 sq.ft. shared private dock, at 2806 Lafayette Ave., Newport Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-18-1014 (Cyprus, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Kip Cyprus to remove 706 sq.ft., U-shaped dock float, and replace it with 56’ x 8’, single finger dock float with 14’ x 12’ landing at landward end of float; alterations to existing pier platform; and remove four 12-in. diameter concrete piles and replace with four, 14-in. diameter concrete piles, at 221 Via Lido Soud, Newport Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-18-1156 (Naehring, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Matt Naehring for development located within Coastal Commission original jurisdiction consisting of: demolition of duplex and construction of 4,214 sq.ft., 29-ft. high, 3-story, 2-unit condominium with 2 attached single-car garages totaling 461 sq.ft. and 2 carport spaces; Tentative Parcel Map to consolidate 2 lots, and seawall repairs, including raising the seawall cap by 3 ft., installation of 2 tie back supports, each affixed to new concrete deadman, and installation of 2 new additional tie back supports affixed to seawall, at 3406 Marcus Ave., Newport Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

(MV-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: City of Pacifica LCP Amendment No. LCP-2-PAC-19-0043-1 (Cannabis Regulations)
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Pacifica to modify the LCP’s Implementation Plan regulations related to allowable residential and commercial cannabis uses is de minimis. (JM-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 2-16-0784 (2 Mirada Ownership Group & Casa Mira Homeowner’s Association Mirada Armoring, Half Moon Bay)
subitem_blurb: Application of 2 Mirada Ownership Group and Casa Mira Homeowner’s Association to construct approx. 257-ft. long tied-back concrete seawall with public access staircase fronting both residential development and California Coastal Trail near where Mirada Rd. intersects the shoreline at the bridge over Arroyo de en Medio in Half Moon Bay, San Mateo County. (SR/JM-SF)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission’s Santa Cruz office at (831) 427-4863.

subitem_title: City of Pacific Grove LCP Certification No. LCP-3-PGR-18-0093-1
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Pacific Grove to update the LCP Land Use Plan and to certify a new Implementation Plan for the first time (for a complete LCP). (BO-SC)

subitem_title: San Luis Obispo County LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-SLO-19-0009-1 (Cannabis Regulations Update). Certification Review
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the action by San Luis Obispo County accepting certification of LCP-3-SLO-19-0009-1 with modifications (making minor and clarifying changes to the County’s cannabis regulations) is legally adequate. (SC-SC)

subitem_title: San Luis Obispo County LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-SLO-19-0021-2 (Affordable Housing)
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by San Luis Obispo County to modify the LCP’s requirements for certain development to provide inclusionary housing units or inclusionary fees is minor. (BO-SC)

subitem_title: City of Pismo Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-PSB-19-0044-1 (Short-Term/Vacation Rentals)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Pismo Beach to amend the LCP Implementation Plan to: add short-term rentals as an allowed use in the R-2 and R-3 zoning districts; refine criteria for vacation rentals in the Downtown Core; and add a definition of long-term rental. (KB-SC)

subitem_title: Oceano Dunes State Vehicular Recreation Area (ODSVRA) CDP Review
subitem_blurb: Review of the overall effectiveness of the methods being used to manage vehicle impacts in relation to coastal resources at ODSVRA as required by coastal permit 4-82-300, as amended, in the Oceano Dunes area of San Luis Obispo County. To submit a comment, please send an email to OceanoDunesReview@coastal.ca.gov prior to Friday, July 5, 2019 at 5:00PM PDT. (KK-SC).

subitem_title: Application No. 3-19-0463 (Morro Bay Water Reclamation Facility)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Morro Bay to: (1) subdivide 396-acre parcel into 2 parcels (roughly 368 and 28 acres apiece); (2) construct new wastewater treatment and recycled water facility (water reclamation facility) on smaller parcel, as well as to construct associated pipelines, 2 new lift stations, and underground recycled water injection wells; (3) modify existing ocean outfall; (4) operate new water reclamation facility and overall system, including groundwater injection and other related components, moving forward; and, (5) decommission and demolish existing wastewater treatment plant and related components and to restore all affected areas, with project components spanning unincorporated San Luis Obispo County, City of Morro Bay, and the Pacific Ocean. (KK-SC)

subitem_title: Application No. 3-19-0020 (San Simeon Wastewater Treatment Plant, San Luis Obispo Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of San Simeon Community Services District for after-the-fact development at its wastewater treatment plant (WWTP), including installation of riprap revetment, improvements to pipe support structure, structural and component upgrades to the WWTP, and partial replacement and other development associated with WWTP’s outfall pipe, at 9245 Balboa Ave. in unincorporated San Simeon Acres area of North San Luis Obispo County. (BO-SC)

subitem_title: Application No. 3-18-1039 (Cieslak, Asilomar Dunes, Pacific Grove)
subitem_blurb: Application of Tiffany and Jeremy Cieslak to construct 2,942 sq.ft. single-family home with attached garage, driveway, patios, and dune restoration on 23,137 sq.ft. vacant parcel at 1635 Sunset Dr. in Asilomar Dunes neighborhood of City of Pacific Grove, Monterey County. (BO-SC)

subitem_title: Dispute Resolution No. 3-19-0569-EDD (Cal-Am, Marina)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and Commission determination on dispute over appealability (pursuant to California Code of Regulations, Title 14, Section 13569) of the coastal development permit denied by the City of Marina for the components of the Monterey Peninsula Water Supply Project located in the City of Marina’s jurisdiction. (KB-SC)

item_blurb: Report by Chief of Enforcement on Statewide Enforcement Program. (LAH-SF)

item_title: Call to Order and Roll Call
California Coastal Commission and Local Government Public Workshop
item_blurb: Joint workshop with the League of Cities, California State Association of Counties, local government officials and the California Coastal Commission to discuss coastal city and county issues and concerns related to interactions with the Commission on short-term rentals, sea level rise, and LCP development process, including framework for coordination. Agenda and background material for the workshop will be available on the Commission’s website. (JA/MC-SF)

item_title: (NOTE: There will be no more than one (1) hour for public comment. Due to the significant level of interest in this item and the limited time available, speakers’ time will be limited to 1 to 2 minutes, depending on the number of speakers, and at the discretion of the Commission Chair. We urge written comments be submitted to: StatewidePlanning@coastal.ca.gov.)
The Public Workshop will run from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.
There will be no General Public Comment on Friday
